module.name: possession_of_property
module.keywords: module, property, physical quantity, individual, possession, characterisation

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the possession of a physical quantity value by an individual product or activity.

example.p: The vessel V4507 has a maximum operating pressure of 15 bar. This statement makes use of the following concepts:

ul.li: vessel V4507, which is an individual product;
15 bar, which is a physical quantity value; and
the maximum operating pressure relationship between the vessel V4507 and 15 bar.

example.p: The relationship can be defined by this application module.
The activity 'operation of pump P4506 from 10:00 to 10:30 on 2004-07-24' has a total mass pumped of 30000 kg.. This statement makes use of the following concepts:

ul.li: 'operation of pump P4506 from 10:00 to 10:30 on 2004-07-24', which is an individual activity;
30000 kg, which is a physical quantity value; and
the total mass pumped relationship between the activity and 30000 kg.

example.p: The relationship can be defined by this application module.

inscope.li: the relationship between am individual product or individual activity and a physical quantity value.

li.p: the nature of a possession of property relationship;

note.p: The relationship between a vessel and a pressure can be classified as a 'maximum operating pressure' relationship or a 'hydrostatic test pressure' relationship. The class of possessioin of property is within the scope of the Property_space application module.

li.p: the definition of a physical quantity value;

note.p: A physical quantity value is within the scope of the Independent_property_definition application module.

li.p: the identification of a physical quantity value with respect to a unit of measure.

note.p: The identification of a physical quantity value with respect to a unit of measure is within the scope of the Property_identification application module.

li.p: a criterion for membership of a class of product or class of activity;

note.p: A property condition is within the scope of the Property_condition application module.

uof.name: Possession_of_property
uof.description: The Possession_of_property UoF specifies the classification of an individual product or activity as a member of the class that is an independent property definition.

alt_map.description: If the described_element is an individual activity.
If the described_element is an individual product.
